body_html:
@yingjianling I was under the impression that when using datasets.ImageFolder, the dataset infers the number of classes from the number of folders in the data directory. Maybe as @mruberry says there is a mismatch between the inferred number and the number you manually specify (9092) and that is somehow causing the problem.

I will try to reproduce the failure locally. Can it be triggered using an easily accessible (e.g. torchvision) dataset?
body_text:
@yingjianling I was under the impression that when using datasets.ImageFolder, the dataset infers the number of classes from the number of folders in the data directory. body:
@yingjianling I was under the impression that when using `datasets.ImageFolder`, the dataset infers the number of classes from the number of folders in the data directory.  Maybe as @mruberry says there is a mismatch between the inferred number and the number you manually specify (9092) and that is somehow causing the problem.

I will try to reproduce the failure locally.  Can it be triggered using an easily accessible (e.g. torchvision) dataset?
